Module lanat
Package lanat.utils

Class ErrorsContainerImpl<T extends ErrorLevelProvider>

java.lang.Object
lanat.utils.ErrorsContainerImpl<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of the errors to store.
All Implemented Interfaces:
ErrorsContainer<T>, Resettable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ArgumentType, Command, ParsingStateBase
public abstract class ErrorsContainerImpl<T extends ErrorLevelProvider> extends Object implements ErrorsContainer<T>, Resettable
A container for errors. This class is used to store errors and their respective minimum error levels. It also has methods for getting errors under the minimum error level.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ErrorsContainerImpl()
    Creates a new ErrorsContainerImpl with the default values, those being ErrorLevel.ERROR for minimumExitErrorLevel and ErrorLevel.INFO for minimumDisplayErrorLevel.

    Creates a new ErrorsContainerImpl with the given values.

    • setMinimumExitErrorLevel

      public void setMinimumExitErrorLevel(@NotNull @NotNull ErrorLevel level)
      The minimum error level that will cause the program to exit. All errors with a level equal to or higher than this will cause the program to exit. For example, if this is set to ErrorLevel.WARNING, then all errors with a level of ErrorLevel.WARNING or ErrorLevel.ERROR will cause the program to exit.
      Specified by:
      setMinimumExitErrorLevel in interface ErrorsContainer<T extends ErrorLevelProvider>
      Parameters:
      level - the minimum exit error level

    • getMinimumExitErrorLevel

      @NotNull public @NotNull utils.ModifyRecord<ErrorLevel> getMinimumExitErrorLevel()

      Returns the minimum level that errors should have in order to cause the program to exit.
      Specified by:
      getMinimumExitErrorLevel in interface ErrorsContainer<T extends ErrorLevelProvider>
      Returns:
      the minimum exit error level

    • setMinimumDisplayErrorLevel

      public void setMinimumDisplayErrorLevel(@NotNull @NotNull ErrorLevel level)
      The minimum error level that will be displayed to the user. All errors with a level lower than this will be ignored. For example: If this is set to ErrorLevel.INFO, then all errors (including ErrorLevel.INFO, ErrorLevel.WARNING, and ErrorLevel.ERROR) will be displayed, but ErrorLevel.DEBUG will not.
      Specified by:
      setMinimumDisplayErrorLevel in interface ErrorsContainer<T extends ErrorLevelProvider>
      Parameters:
      level - the minimum display error level
